intro: Polygala remota, commonly known as the remote milk-vetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family, which includes over 700 species of herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in spiny or branched inflorescences, and come in shades of pink, purple, or white. Polygala remota is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
